description: A high school principal and two others have been shot by a student, a police official said.
title: Student arrested after three shot at French high school
title_page: Student arrested after three shot at French high school | Daily Mail Online
text:
A high school principal and two others have been shot by a 17-year-old student in southern France, a police official said.
Authorities believe there is no reason to suspect the attack was terror-related.
Police surrounded the area around the Alexis de Tocqueville school in the town of Grasse.
In this image from TV, Police cordon off the area as people gather to view the nearby high school in Grasse
In addition to the three wounded in Thursday’s shooting, five other people are being treated for shock, the official said.
None of the injuries are life-threatening.
The student has been arrested for possessing weapons.
The official said there did not appear to be any other suspects, although police are working to “remove all doubt”.
A French police message alert is displayed on a cell phone in Paris
A pupil at the high school said he heard four shots that sparked panic among students.
The visibly shaken student told BFM TV that “it was total panic” at the school in Grasse, the picturesque perfume capital of France.
He said: “I was downstairs…We started to run. I was with a buddy and we took refuge upstairs. Then the riot police arrived. It was like in a film.”
The student, giving the first witness account of the incident, was identified only as Andreas.
He said: “We hear this kind of thing in Paris. Now we understand what it is.”
